In a message dated 1/4/03 3:42:26 AM Central Standard Time, 
hollywood.narrator@... writes:


> OOC: Adults of the time? Transformers came out in 1984, and the movie came 
> out I believe in 1986, so you have to expect it to be a "kid's movie." 
> However, the original theatrical presentation of the movie featured the 
> words "damn" and "shit," and thus would qualify it as having adult 
> language, yes?...

Just because of the words, which they were taken out to my knowledge & later 
readded.... by film critics, it's a children's movie. Go to your local Video 
rental store & search for it under any other title, but I guarnatee you will 
only find it under Childrens. It's primary forcus was upon the Gen X/kids of 
that time. Few adults liked it as much as the kids, unlike now, where Gen 1 
is huge because it was what we grew up upon. 
Yes, it was released in '86, 2 years after Transformers arrived in the US. 
But no one grows up that quickly. I was 8 in '84 & 10 in '86. 

stac

--part1_87.24ebb374.2b48ee38_boundary
